questions.text: A 6-month-old infant is admitted with severe vomiting and requires placement of a gastric tube. The nurse sets up the feeding equipment as shown in the image. Which of the following tubes is correctly depicted in the image?
All of the following are true statements regarding central venous catheters except-

options.label: A
options.text: The tip of the catheter is situated in the inferior vena cava

options.label: B
options.text: The most dangerous complication is pneumothorax

options.label: C
options.text: Inside OT, the Internal jugular vein is the preferred vein

options.label: D
options.text: In acutely injured, critically ill patients Femoral vein is the preferred vein

questions.correct_answer: A. The tip of the catheter is situated in the inferior vena cava
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ The tip is located in the superior vena cava
  • ↳ Order of preference: Subclavian vein > Internal jugular vein > Femoral vein (Option D)
  • ↳ (Option D)
  • ↳ Inside OT: Internal jugular vein (Option C)
  • ↳ (Option C)
  • ↳ Outside OT: Subclavian vein
  • ↳ Complications: catheter-related sepsis, pneumothorax (Option B)
  • ↳ (Option B)
